alert.note: Alert for Parmer (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 10:47PM CDT until further notice by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Southern Parmer County in the far southwestern Texas Panhandle. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1044 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated continuing rainfall due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is likely ongoing in the advisory area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Although the heaviest rain has ended, light to moderate rain is expected to continue and additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. This additional rain will result in the continuation of minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lazbuddie and Oklahoma Lane. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
